At 12:43 PM 11/07/2001, chw@... wrote:
>Folks:
>
>I am using Junit (I am a newbie at it) with Log4j (which we use
>extensively) and I cannot seem to get the Log4j stuff initialized.
>
>When I put the DOMConfigurator.configure() call from Log4j in main(),
>it is apparently lost when the test cases are run (different class
>loader? causing the singleton functions to use a different set
>objects?)
>
>When I put the Log4j config stuff in the setUp(), I get the following.
>
>Any suggestions what the problem is and how to work around it?

I've found the simplest thing to do is to let log4j do it's own default 
initialization by using the -Dlog4j.configuration=path/url on the junit 
command line or by naming the file log4j.properties and putting it on the 
classpath prior to running junit.

HTH

Robert
